Pre-Game Insights: The three-match ODI series between Sri Lanka and India kicks off on Friday, August 2, with the first game to be played at R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.
India whitewashed Sri Lanka in the three-match T20I series.
Riyan Parag, Shivam Dube and Harshit Rana have earned their maiden call-ups to the ODI side.
Charith Asalanka has been named the new ODI captain of Sri Lanka.
Matheesha Pathirana and Dilshan Madhushanka have been ruled out of the ODI series due to injuries.
Uncapped seamers Mohamed Shiraz and Eshan Malinga have been added to the squad.

India were fantastic in the T20I series and whitewashed Sri Lanka. The hosts will have to fire in unison to put up a fight against the upbeat Indians who will be looking to carry forward the winning momentum in the ODI series.
Prediction: India to win this contest.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The surface at R. Premadasa Stadium is expected to be a well-balanced one. The seamers should get some early assistance from the surface but it will get better as the game progresses. The spinners will come into play in the middle overs as the ball gets old.
There is a 70% chance of rain predicted, with the temperature expected to be in the mid-20s.
